main event: Several witnesses reported seeing unidentified flying objects over Orangeburg, South Carolina, on 25 March 1950.
interesting points: Witnesses described a disk-shaped object that appeared to turn slowly and then disappear and reappear in the western sky., The object was reported to leave a vapor trail as it moved., One witness stated the object was about the size of a new moon and brighter., Reports hinted at similarities with other sightings occurring concurrently in different locations, including California., The objects were noted for their extremely fast speed and high altitude, making detailed observation difficult.
witness description: staff members from a local newspaper and residents of Orangeburg
